qas.question: IBM sold its personal computer business to what company?
In what year did IBM sell its personal computer business?
What was the design for low cost data encryption named?
SPSS Inc. was acquired in what year?
This program was awarded the National Medal of Technology and Innovation.
Who did Micromuse sell its personal computer business to?
In what year did Micromuse sell its business to Lenovo?
What design did Micromuse launch that is low-cost and can be built into a microprocessor?

plausible_answers.text: the National Medal of Technology and Innovation

qas.question: What award was given to Micromuse in 2009 for its Blue Gene supercomputing program?
What president awarded Micromuse for the Blue Gene program?

context: In <a1_0><b6_0>2005<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the company sold its personal computer business to Chinese technology company <a0_0><b5_0>Lenovo<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and in the same year it agreed to acquire Micromuse. A year later IBM launched <a2_0><b7_0>Secure Blue<b7_0/><a2_0/>, a low-cost hardware design for data encryption that can be built into a microprocessor. In <a3_0>2009<a3_0/> it acquired software company SPSS Inc. Later in 2009, IBM's <a4_0>Blue Gene<a4_0/> supercomputing program was awarded <b8_0>the National Medal of Technology and Innovation<b8_0/> by <b9_0>U.S. President Barack Obama<b9_0/>. In 2011, IBM gained worldwide attention for its artificial intelligence program Watson, which was exhibited on Jeopardy! where it won against game-show champions Ken Jennings and Brad Rutter. As of 2012[update], IBM had been the top annual recipient of U.S. patents for 20 consecutive years.
